column9: Gas gas gas   Cramps spasms and chronic diarrhea Feel so frustrated.  Swapping one evil for another

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I like many have bad gas and some abdominal pain. I find it lowers my sugar a lot. I take less insulin now. It has also caused some weight loss which I need the most.

column2: ironstar2006, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I don't have to worry that my sugar level will take a dive after I eat anymore.  My glucose used to go from 186 after meal and drop to 54 within 1-1.5 hrs. later.

column9: Given acarbose for hypoglycemia.  A lot of gas produced.  Taking 25-50 mg per meal.  Does not keep blood sugar from falling very well.

column2: Bill, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: zoozan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have not used this drug.  Just looking it up.  Published this week in Dr. Gott's column in local newspaper, patient reports using it for fatigue.  (no mention of diabetes)I do not have diabetes, but do have post polio fatigue.

column2: Iron Bunny, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I could power a small city with the gas I produce.  Gas-X doesn't make a dent in the gas production.  I stopped taking it days before a significant event and the gas production went away.  I have discontinued taking Acarbose until I see my endocrinologist next month.  I need an alternative to Acarbose.  I discontinued Actos because of the fluid retention.  At least fluid retention does not produce gas.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Every time i take it I get acid indigestion!!!!!

column2: rph333, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: ?After having too many side effects with Metformin and severe reaction with Pioglitazone, I was prescribed Acarbose ( all generic names).Beside some gas problem, I tolerated this better then others. But my blood glucose level was not significantly reduced? Fasting Glucose is still 110 mg/dL , though I have reduced my total caloric intake and very careful with carbohydrates intake. I'm borderline Diabetic and a retired pharmacistI will continue for few weeks before I discuss with my physician and at present taking 300 mg per day in three divided doses. This is the max dose recommended.
